description: A four-year-old child was found severely injured near Tarakeshwar railway station after being abducted from her home. Her grandfather has been arrested in connection with the incident. Allegations of delayed police action and a potential sexual assault have led to protests and a renewed investigation.

title: ‘They were holding a grudge’: Teen shoots schoolmate with father’s pistol; 2 accused arrested
description: A 17-year-old boy allegedly shot his schoolmate with his father's licensed pistol in Gurgaon's Sector 48, leaving the victim critically injured. The accused and another minor friend were apprehended shortly after the incident. Police recovered the weapon and ammunition from the rented accommodation, with the motive reportedly stemming from a two-month-old argument.

description: Madhya Pradesh chief minister Mohan Yadav has assured that Munna Singh Gaud, the father of women’s World Cup–winning cricketer Kranti Gaud, will be reinstated as police constable. Gaud was dismissed in 2012 after an alleged error during election duty. The announcement came during Kranti’s felicitation ceremony in Bhopal, where the CM commended the bowler for bringing glory to the nation and her state.

The assistant sub-inspector allegedly drove his SUV into multiple vehicles. Eyewitnesses reported he was heavily intoxicated, with liquor bottles found in his car. The victim's family protested, demanding justice.

The veteran is anticipated to rejoin the Indian squad for the upcoming ODI series against South Africa, commencing November 30.

Companies like Amazon, Google, and Meta are prioritizing AI and automation, leading to layoffs in roles once considered secure.  This shift emphasizes efficiency over loyalty, forcing professionals to adapt.  The future of work demands continuous learning and adaptability as AI reshapes industries and job roles.

After Darshan's viral pic, terror accused seen using smartphones inside Bengaluru jail
description: Videos of prisoners, including serial rapist Umesh Reddy and a terror case accused, using mobile phones inside Bengaluru's Central Prison have surfaced. This security lapse has prompted an inquiry into how the phones were provided and who is involved. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has ordered a report and action against those responsible.

title: 'What’s the problem?': German tourist harassed by local cabbies in Goa; taxi-app turf war deepens
description: A German travel influencer faced harassment in Goa when local rickshaw drivers demanded an exorbitant fare, forcing him to use the app-based GoaMiles. The situation escalated with threats, police intervention, and a fine for the GoaMiles driver, highlighting a growing turf war impacting tourism.

title: From toasted to roasted: Trump wines sales in military cantonments invite flak
description: US military stores are reportedly selling Trump-branded wines, sparking ethical concerns despite official claims of legality. This incident echoes broader accusations of the Trump family's self-enrichment, including a crypto venture with Pakistan that critics allege strained US-India ties. Lavish White House events during a government shutdown also drew sharp criticism for insensitivity.

title: Bill Gates on foundation’s role; not replacing US aid: ‘That’s not our job’
description: The Gates Foundation has pledged $2.5 billion over five years to advance global women's health, marking a significant increase in their investment. This funding will primarily support research and development for innovations like self-injectable contraceptives and rapid STI diagnostics, aiming to address long-overlooked health disparities and catalyze broader action.

title: Why experts call calf muscles the body’s ‘second heart’ & 5 ways to keep them strong
description: A powerful muscle in the lower body quietly supports the heart’s work every single day. Experts say it plays a far greater role in circulation and vitality than most people realise.

title: Canada’s $1.2 bn plan to woo H-1B visa holders; reveals new immigration plan
description: Canada is rolling out a new immigration strategy, aiming to attract over 1,000 top researchers with a $1.2 billion investment. The nation plans to welcome 380,000 permanent residents annually from 2026-2028.  An accelerated pathway for H-1B visa holders is also in the works, potentially drawing skilled professionals from the US.

title: 'Success takes time': Nvidia CEO tells Zuckerberg- here's what he said
description: Nvidia's Jensen Huang and Meta's Mark Zuckerberg shared insights on AI's future and building tech empires. Huang humorously wished he'd dropped out like Zuckerberg, while both acknowledged their long journeys and mutual admiration. Nvidia's remarkable rise to a $5 trillion valuation was highlighted, contrasting with Zuckerberg's own dorm-room beginnings leading to Meta's trillion-dollar status.
